alert.note: Alert for Tillamook (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 12:47PM PST until January 07 at 10:43PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon...Washington... Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Nehalem River near Foss affecting Tillamook and Clatsop Counties. Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. Willapa River near Willapa affecting Pacific County. Naselle River near Naselle affecting Pacific and Wahkiakum Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wilson River near Tillamook. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...Above 14.0 feet, widespread lowland and dairy land flooding begins. Sloughs north of the city, mainly Dougherty, begin to overflow. Minor flooding begins in the business district north of Tillamook and along Hwy 101, particularly during high tide. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM PST Friday the stage was 13.6 feet. - The river crested at 14.1 feet at 800 AM PST Friday morning. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tonight. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tonight at 1000 PM PST.
